data.name: txtboxHelp.Text
data.value:
TOP MENU-> File->Load Loads a given simulation. Note the extension is .txt. This will load an existing celular automation initial state. File->Save Saves a given simulation. You should use the .txt extension for this. File->Clear Screen Clears the screen of the existing simulation. Be careful! If you want to save the current automation, you will not be able to do so after this! File->Frame Time Allows you to change how quickly the simulation moves from one state to the next. Mode-> There are two modes, the one allows you to create a world or stop the existing simulation (same thing). The other mode runs the simulation at the given frame time (or as close as it can to the frame time depending upon the size of the world) You must be in Create mode to modify things. Patterns-> This is a list of available patterns you may add to your simulation. You may also create your own patterns and save them here. To load a pattern to the screen select one, then right mouse click to get the context sensitive menu, then select 'Add to World'. The pattern will show up on the screen and move with the mouse. Right mouse click to drop the pattern where you want it.
Delete does what it states and removes the selected pattern from the list. Be careful make sure you want to delete a pattern, after it is deleted there is no getting it back.
Create New allows you to add your own custom patterns to the list. When you select it, you can then doubleclick on cells to turn them on and off to create your own pattern. The pattern will be in Purple color. After you are finished creating your pattern, right click the mouse. A dialog will be displayed allowing you to give the pattern a name. Enter a name and select ok. Your pattern will now show up on the list. And you can use it in the future. Random Pattern-> Allows you to create a block of cells of a given size. Each cell within will be randomly turned on based on the probability to select. After you select the parameters you want, hit OK. The pattern will appear on the screen you can move it about with the mouse. Right click the mouse to let place the pattern at a given position.
Controlling the Screen: The most important thing to realize about this version of Conway's game of life it the size of the screen is infinite. You can zoom in and out of the the world by using the mouse scroll wheel. You can pan around the world by holding down the left mouse button and moving the mouse. You may want to practice this. When zooming in, it will always zoom in with respect to the current center of the screen.
If you have further questions you may contact me: Dennis Bingaman ddbtech@hughes.net
